item.title: A.I. Enters the Museum
item.description: Talented artists are using the technology to do what talented artists always will: ask human questions and express human ideas.

item.title: My Brother’s an Unpleasant Drunk. Can I Cut Him Off?
item.description: Life feels too short to keep walking on eggshells around him.

item.title: How Anime Took Over America
item.description: “Demon Slayer” is just the latest confirmation of how Japan’s once-distinctive animation style has become a global visual language.

item.title: The Old Climate-Activism Playbook No Longer Works. What Else Can?
item.description: Activists are hoping to recreate the magic of 1970’s Earth Day — at a moment when the movement’s future is cloudier than ever.

item.title: Can I Give Out Full-Size Candy Bars to Children on Halloween?
item.description: A ruling on confectionary etiquette in the haunted season.

item.title: How Has Being Perpetually Single Affected You?
item.description: We want to hear from women over the age of 30 who feel as if they have not yet had a meaningful relationship for a New York Times Magazine feature.

item.title: Brené Brown Doesn’t Want to Be Your Self-Help Guru Anymore
item.description: The author and podcaster wants to apply her old ideas about vulnerability and empathy to the workplace.

item.title: I’ve Prepped for Future Disasters. Do I Have to Help Those Who Didn’t?
item.description: We can’t be the emergency food bank for everyone, but could we really let others suffer?

item.title: An Essay Contest Winner Used A.I. Should She Return the $1,000 Award?
item.description: What happened should be taken as a wake-up call, rather than a crime scene.

item.title: Guitar Nerds and Surf Bros Didn’t Want to ‘Get Political.’ Then Came the Tariffs.
item.description: In the online niches where people discuss guitars, surfing, makeup and countless other interests, ideology is becoming harder to quarantine.

item.title: A Jane Austen-Inspired Roast Chicken That’s Remarkably Well Done
item.description: A pairing of grapes and red onions makes a classic recipe feel especially current.

item.title: How Charlie Kirk Became the Youth Whisperer of the American Right
item.description: Collecting donors, voters, TikTok viewers and high-powered friends on his way into Trump’s inner circle.

item.title: How a Group of Students in the Pacific Islands Reshaped Global Climate Law
item.description: They watched climate change ravage their home countries as rich, polluting nations did nothing. Then they had an idea.
